title: Pro-Palestinian flotilla departs Tunisia in largest bid yet to break Gaza blockade
byline: A flotilla of 18 vessels carrying pro-Palestinian activists has left the Tunisian port of Bizerte in what organizers called the largest attempt yet to challenge Israel’s naval blockade of Gaza, Tunisia’s state news agency TAP reported on Monday.

title: Woman dead, seven injured in fatal accident on Southern Expressway
byline: A woman has died and seven others have been injured in an accident that occurred between the Galenigama and Kahathuduwa interchanges on the Southern Expressway.

title: Drug-related arrests increase by 41% in 2024: Police
byline: Over 228,000 individuals have been arrested in 2024 for drug-related offenses, an increase of about 41 percent compared to 2023, police stated.

title: ‘I am humbly proud to have been a people’s leader’: Mahinda Rajapaksa
byline: Former President Mahinda Rajapaksa says he has spent the greater part of his life among the people and even today, that remains the same.

title: Donald Trump says Netanyahu “won’t be hitting” Qatar again
byline: US President Donald Trump insisted Monday that Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu would not strike Qatar again, after an attack on Hamas last week that infuriated Washington’s Gulf ally.

title: Cloudy skies, several spells of showers expected in several areas today
byline: Cloudy skies can be expected over the Northern, North-Central, Eastern, Uva and Central provinces today (16), the Department of Meteorology said.

title: Nepal’s deadly protests hammer tourism sector as arrivals fall 30%
byline: Nepal’s deadliest protests in decades erupted just as the country entered its peak tourist season, dealing a blow to businesses that had been preparing to welcome trekkers from around the globe to experience its world-famous trails.

title: Dy Minister Sunil Watagala lodges complaint with CID over defamatory social media posts
byline: Deputy Minister of Public Security Sunil Watagala states that he has lodged a complaint with the Criminal Investigation Department (CID) regarding malicious and false statements being circulated about him on social media.

title: Over 75,000 tourists arrive in first two weeks of September
byline: The number of tourists who arrived in the country in the first two weeks of September stood at 75,358, the Sri Lanka Tourism Development Authority has announced.

title: Sri Lanka eyes 6% growth in 2026, but 2025 outlook dims amid spending delays: Dy Minister
byline: Sri Lanka is aiming to boost its economic growth to up to 6% in 2026, partly through record government capital expenditure, though delays in passing the budget could drag on its performance this year, Deputy Minister of Economic Development Anil Jayantha Fernando said.

title: Social media platforms required to deactivate accounts of under-16s under Australian ban
byline: Social media companies will be required to detect and deactivate accounts held by underage children when Australia’s world-first under-16 ban comes into effect in December, the government revealed on Tuesday.

title: US negotiators in India to revive trade deal talks amid Trump Tariff overhang
byline: A team of US negotiators will hold discussions with Indian officials in New Delhi today (16) to revive talks on a bilateral trade deal.

title: Cannes Winner Vimukthi Jayasundara’s Busan Competition Film ‘Spying Stars’ debuts first trailer
byline: The first trailer for “Spying Stars,” the latest feature from acclaimed Sri Lankan filmmaker Vimukthi Jayasundara, has been unveiled ahead of its world premiere in competition at the 30th Busan International Film Festival.

title: 27,500 individuals subjected to inspection during special police operation
byline: A total of 598 individuals have been arrested on suspicion of being involved in criminal activities and also over illicit liquor and drug-related offenses during a special island-wide operation conducted yesterday (15).

title: Digital signature introduced for government entities to enhance efficiency
byline: A digital signature system has been introduced for public officials with the aim of making official duties easier and more efficient.

title: iOS 26: Apple releases huge, controversial iPhone update
byline: Apple has released new software for the iPhone and all of its other products.

title: IGP departs for China
byline: Inspector General of Police (IGP) Priyantha Weerasooriya has left the island to participate in a police conference being held in China.

title: Sri Lanka’s PMI for August expands
byline: The Central Bank of Sri Lanka’s purchasing manager’s report for August 2025 has shown that the manufacturing index expanded to 55.2 in the month of August this year.

title: CEB workers to report sick in groups to oppose restructuring
byline: The Executive Committee Member of the Ceylon Electricity Board Engineers’ Union (CEBEU), Dhanushka Parakramasinghe announced that the trade union action launched in protest against the government’s decision to divide the Ceylon Electricity Board (CEB) into four entities, will be intensified from today (16).

title: World Bank Vice President concludes first official visit to Sri Lanka
byline: The World Bank’s Vice President for South Asia, Johannes Zutt, concluded his first official visit to Sri Lanka yesterday (15).

title: Southern Province first to adopt GovPay for digital payments across all Secretariats
byline: All District and Divisional Secretariats across the Southern Province are now empowered to accept digital payments following the adoption of GovPay, the Government Digital Payments Platform.

title: 15 injured in Epitawala accident involving bus and lorry
byline: A total of 15 individuals have sustained injuries in an accident involving a private bus and a lorry in Epitawala, along the Horana–Ratnapura main road this morning (16), police stated.

title: Britain to roll out red carpet, royal fanfare for Trump visit
byline: United States President Donald Trump will arrive in Britain on Tuesday (Sep 16) for a three-day trip.

title: Israel has committed genocide in Gaza, UN commission of inquiry says
byline: A United Nations commission of inquiry says Israel has committed genocide against Palestinians in Gaza.

title: Acting Director of Police Cultural Division SSP Sathish Gamage further remanded
byline: The Acting Director of the Police Cultural Division, Senior Superintendent of Police (SSP) Sathish Gamage, who was arrested by the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption (CIABOC) has been further remanded, until September 30, Ada Derana reporter said.

title: Six Sri Lankans abandoned in seas off Talaimannar by traffickers rescued
byline: The Sri Lanka Navy has taken hold of six Sri Lankans, who were abandoned in seas off Talaimannar by human traffickers.
